episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and fascinating topics, including the history of pneumatic tube systems, the creation of bacon-flavored algae, the challenges of telescope maintenance in space, and a peculiar museum in North Korea featuring a scaled-down replica of the world's largest table.

facts.fact: The first item to be sent via New York's pneumatic tube postal system was an artificial peach, and the second was a live black cat.
Scientists have made algae that taste like bacon.
Telescopes have a new telescope smell that can break them.
There is a museum in North Korea that has a scaled down replica of the world's largest table.
